title: 110_s3588
content: The "Healthy Food for Healthy Lives Act of 2008" may be cited as the short title of this Act. It includes definitions for clarity. The "Healthy Food for Healthy Lives Act of 2008" defines key terms such as eligible entity, eligible hospital, eligible organization, and eligible product related to providing nutritious agricultural products through participating vendors. The "Healthy Food for Healthy Lives Act of 2008" emphasizes the importance of locally or regionally produced agricultural food products that maximize nutrient density and reflect local preferences. These products should be grown, stored, and transported within a 400-mile radius to ensure freshness and quality. The term "participating vendor" refers to a local or regional distributor of eligible products approved under section 3(d)(1), including agricultural producers. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. DEMONSTRATION GRANTS FOR HOSPITALS, VA MEDICAL CENTERS, AND NUTRITION PROGRAMS. The Secretary will provide demonstration grants to eligible entities to purchase nutritious meals from local sources for hospitals, VA medical centers, and nutrition programs. Coordination with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Secretary of Health and Human Services is required for grant provision. The Department of Agriculture will carry out a program to supply eligible products to entities using funds from demonstration grants. Local distributors must apply for approval as participating vendors to supply these products. To be eligible for a grant to purchase eligible products, local or regional distributors must demonstrate the ability to supply products, comply with food safety laws, provide products that meet quality standards, and purchase products at a fair price from local growers and processors. To apply for grants to purchase eligible products, eligible entities must submit an application to the Secretary with required information. Priority is given to entities with a commitment to incorporating locally produced food products in their policies. Additionally, eligible organizations must certify their nonprofit status in the grant application. The Secretary will monitor participating vendors and grants under this section, with a certification requirement for vendors. Authorization of appropriations is also included. Authorization of Appropriations for grants to eligible hospitals and organizations: $10,000,000 for hospitals in section 2(2)(A), $10,000,000 for hospitals in section 2(2)(B), and $5,000,000 for organizations for fiscal years 2009 through 2013. The Secretary, in coordination with other Federal agencies, must submit a report to Congress within 2 years of this Act's enactment. The report will provide recommendations on increasing the use of nutritious, local agricultural products in health care and social service programs, as well as ways the Federal Government can offer technical assistance and support for these activities.
